revised_title: Observations on the Fertilization and Early Development of the Stickleback Ovum
tldr: This study investigates the process of ovum impregnation and early development in two species of stickleback fish, Gasterosteus leiurus and G. pungitius. The author describes the structure and function of the micropyle, the role of the chorion, and the changes that occur in the egg after fertilization, including the formation of the respiratory chamber, changes in the yolk layer, and the onset of cleavage.
